collection_page.p: For the purposes of this document, the following terms and definitions apply. Terms defined in ISO 10303-11 and ISO 10303-31 are repeated below for convenience.

NOTE&sp3;Definitions copied verbatim from other standards are followed by a reference to the source standard in square brackets. Definitions that have been adapted from other standards are followed by an explanatory note.
specification, encapsulating at least one test purpose, that provides the formal basis from which executable test cases are derived and that is independent of both the implementation and the values

description of how an implementation is to be tested, given at the appropriate level of abstraction to make the description independent of any particular implementation of testing tools or procedures, but with sufficient detail to enable these tools and procedures to be produced
part of ISO 10303 that contains the set of abstract test cases necessary for conformance testing of an implementation of an application protocol
group of one or more processes creating or using product data
model that describes an application in terms of its processes and information flows
the environment in which the integrated resources are interpreted to support the use of product data in a specific application
logical grouping of interpreted constructs that supports a specific function for the usage of product data across multiple application contexts
information model that uses the integrated resources necessary to satisfy the information requirements and constraints of an application reference model, within an application protocol
atomic element of an application reference model that defines a unique concept of the application and contains attributes specifying the data elements of the object
reusable collection of a scope statement, information requirements, mappings and module interpreted model that supports a specific usage of product data across multiple application contexts
part of ISO 10303 that specifies an application interpreted model satisfying the scope and information requirements for a specific application

NOTE&sp3;This definition differs from the definition used in open system interconnection (OSI) standards. However, since ISO 10303 is not intended to be used directly with OS1 communications, no confusion should arise.
information model that describes the information requirements and constraints of a specific application context
integrated resource whose contents are related to a group of application contexts
product that is decomposable into a set of components or other assemblies from the perspective of a specific application
collection of information models, specified in EXPRESS language, that can be reused to specify application specific information models within the domain of industrial data
NOTE&sp3;The resource constructs defined by an application module are those defined in its module interpreted model schema.
product that is not subject to decomposition from the perspective of a specific application
subset of an application protocol for which conformance may be claimed
subset of an application protocol for which conformance may be claimed in addition to the conformance claimed for a conformance class ???
precise, text definition of a characteristic required to be present in a conforming implementation
testing of a candidate product for the existence of specific characteristics required by a standard in order to determine the extent to which that product is a conforming implementation
representation of information in a formal manner suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by human beings or computers
storing, accessing, transferring, and archiving of data
set of rules for defining data and their relationships suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by computers
computer-interpretable format used for storing, accessing, transferring, and archiving data
integrated resource whose contents are context-independent
part of ISO 10303 that specifies a technique used by computer systems to exchange product data that is described using the EXPREESS data specification language
that part of a product which is to be studied under testing, which should be an implementation of one or more characteristics of the standard(s) based on a given implementation method
facts, concepts, or instructions
formal model of a bounded set of facts, concepts or instructions to meet a specified requirement
part of ISO 10303 that defines a group of resource constructs used as the basis for product data
process of adapting a resource construct from the integrated resources to satisfy a requirement of an application protocol

NOTE&sp3;This may involve the addition of restrictions on attributes, the addition of constraints, the addition of relationships among resource constructs and application constructs, or all of the above
Issue: What is an "application construct"? (See Bug 3337.)
information model that uses the common resources necessary to satisfy the information requirements and constraints of an application reference model, within an application module
standardized document in the form of a questionnaire, which, when completed for a particular implementation, becomes the protocol implementation conformance statement
recognizable visual representation of product data
thing or substance produced by a natural or artificial process
representation of information about a product in a formal manner suitable for communication, interpretation, or processing by human beings or by computers
facts, concepts, or instructions about a product
information model which provides an abstract description of facts, concepts and instructions about a product
statement of which capabilities and options are supported within an implementation of a given standard
NOTE&sp3;This statement is produced by completing a PICS proforma
collection of EXPRESS language entities, types, functions, rules and references that together define a valid description of an aspect of product data
set of interrelated parts of any complex thing, and the relationships between them
precise description of an objective which an abstract test case is designed to achieve

collection of application objects and their relationships that defines one or more concepts within the application context such that removal of any component would render the concepts incomplete or ambiguous
statement of "pass", "fail", or "inconclusive" concerning conformance of an implementation under test with respect to an executable test case and the abstract test case from which it was derived
information defined within an abstract test case which enables the testing laboratory to assign a verdict
For the purposes of this document, the following abbreviated terms apply:

tr.td: Standard for the Exchange of Product Model Data
